dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news coming out of Canada, uh, Oleg Boyko, the Russian businessman, he's actually back on their sanctions list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news coming out of Canada, uh, Oleg Boyko, the Russian businessman, he's actually back on their sanctions list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On November 15, a statement was published on the Canadian government's website indicating that Item 731 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Special Economic Measures (Russia) Regulations is repealed. This section includes Oleg Viktorovich Boyko, born on September 28, 1964.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow, really? I thought, like, he'd been taken *off* that list, didn't he? Like, back in April 2022, I think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow, really? I thought, like, he'd been taken off that list, didn't he? Like, back in April twenty twenty two, I think?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mr. Boyko was added to Canada's sanctions list in April 2022.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he was, you're totally right. But Canada's Minister, Melanie Joly, she, um, advised the government to put him right back on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he was, you're totally right. But Canada's Minister, Melanie Joly, she, um, advised the government to put him right back on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Canada's Foreign Minister, Mlanie Joly, advised her government to remove businessman Oleg Boyko from the list of individuals previously sanctioned in connection with Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So, what happened there? Like, did he just accept it, or...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So, what happened there? Like, did he just accept it, or...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nah, not at all! He actually, uh, filed a lawsuit against the Canadian government in August 2022. His lawyers were saying he's got, you know, significant business interests *in* Canada.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nah, not at all! He actually, uh, filed a lawsuit against the Canadian government in August twenty twenty two. His lawyers were saying he's got, you know, significant business interests in Canada.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In August 2023, Oleg Boyko filed a lawsuit against the Canadian Foreign Ministry in the Federal Court of Canada. The applicant's lawyers insisted that Mr. Boyko has no business in Canada...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] But also, like, ties to Russian authorities, right? That was the argument *against* him being off the list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But also, like, ties to Russian authorities, right? That was the argument against him being off the list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The applicant's lawyers insisted that Mr. Boyko has no business in Canada, and he is not associated with the authorities and state bodies of Russia, and does not participate in Russia's political decision-making.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And actively involved in, uh, Russia's political decision-making, apparently. So, Minister Joly, she, um, reviewed his appeal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And actively involved in, uh, Russia's political decision-making, apparently. So, Minister Joly, she, um, reviewed his appeal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The applicant's lawyers insisted that Mr. Boyko... is not associated with the authorities and state bodies of Russia, and does not participate in Russia's political decision-making.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And she rejected it! Flat out. So, as of December 15th, it's official, he's, like, officially sanctioned again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And she rejected it! Flat out. So, as of December fifteenth, it's official, he's, like, officially sanctioned again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the end, Canada's Foreign Minister, Mlanie Joly... reviewed the appeal and decided to grant it... On November 15, a statement was published on the Canadian government's website indicating that Item 731... is repealed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, Boyko's lawyers must be pretty unhappy about that, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, Boyko's lawyers must be pretty unhappy about that, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. His lawyer called it "biased and unfair," saying it's, uh, strengthening sanctions against politically connected businessmen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. His lawyer called it biased and unfair, saying it's, uh, strengthening sanctions against politically connected businessmen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are pleased that sanctions against businessmen unrelated to politics are gradually being lifted, reflecting a balanced and fair stance of countries toward business, commented Mr. Boyko's lawyer on the decision of the Canadian authorities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And just to remind our listeners, what kind of business is Boyko involved in, exactly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And just to remind our listeners, what kind of business is Boyko involved in, exactly?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He's the founder of Finstar Financial Group. Like, a huge investment firm with activities across, uh, five different countries. We're talking financial services, IT, real estate, entertainment...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's the founder of Finstar Financial Group. Like, a huge investment firm with activities across, uh, five different countries. We're talking financial services, I T, real estate, entertainment...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oleg Boyko is the founder and chairman of the supervisory board of Finstar Financial Group, engaged in investment activities in 25 countries worldwide...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] So, a big player then. And is this just a Canada thing, or are other countries following suit?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a big player then. And is this just a Canada thing, or are other countries following suit?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, actually. His lawyer also mentioned that, uh, work is underway to strengthen sanctions against him in the United States too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, actually. His lawyer also mentioned that, uh, work is underway to strengthen sanctions against him in the United States too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Mr. Boyko's lawyer, work is currently underway to lift sanctions in Australia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, interesting. So, a wider push there then. Thanks for breaking that down, Host_A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, interesting. So, a wider push there then. Thanks for breaking that down, Host_A.
